pullRequest.title: [Python] Fix Python UTF-8 Encoding Issue

commit.message: Try decoding but don't bail on error
Switch binary and ByteArray to bytes
Read content type and parse appropriately
Remove response parsing and just return the data
Update petshop examples w/ new generator code
Move response decoding to inside _preload_content block
Use a raw string for the regex pattern
Add bytes to python primitives as it's supported in 2.7 and 3
Add bytes to the exports from model_utils
Add conditional typing for regex pattern to match variable type
Use read() instead of text() for asyncio
Add newline to kick Circle to re-run
Add sample updates that didn't run with the --batch flag
Remove extra bracket in regex to remove warning

nodes.bodyText: Why is this None? Can we add a byte example here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -490,7 +490,7 @@ with petstore_api.ApiClient(configuration) as api_client:
     number = 3.4 # float | None
 double = 3.4 # float | None
 pattern_without_delimiter = 'pattern_without_delimiter_example' # str | None
-byte = 'byte_example' # str | None
+byte = None # bytes | None

commit.message: Add bytes examples to python doc generators
Remove print statements from generated clients
Update bytes example in FakeApi.md. Again. I swear.
Add yet another seemingly missing doc update

nodes.bodyText:
So we used to have e.body decoded here.
Your change as-is is breaking for the python generator because you are changing the type of e.body.
Sorry, I know that in the related issue I suggested putting it in the api client but I didn't know that it wouldbe a breaking change.
Can you move you decoding code into rest.mustache to make this a non-breaking change?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -50,7 +51,8 @@ def test_404_error(self):
         except ApiException as e:
             self.assertEqual(e.status, 404)
             self.assertEqual(e.reason, "Not Found")
-            self.checkRegex(e.body, "Pet not found")
+            body = e.body.decode('utf-8') if six.PY3 else e.body
+            self.checkRegex(body, "Pet not found")

commit.message: Catch the error, decode the body, and re-throw
Remove the updates now that the change is non-breaking

nodes.bodyText:
Can you rename this deserialize_binary_to_str ?
The current name implies that we expect to receive binary data and process it as binary in downstream consumers.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -377,6 +380,36 @@ def get_header(name, default=None):
         finally:
             os.unlink(file_path)
 
+    def test_deserialize_binary(self):

nodes.bodyText:
No longer needed because we are only concerned with bytes in the python layer when grabbing the raw response?
This comment also applies to lines lines 138, 139, 905-909 and to modules/openapi-generator/src/main/java/org/openapitools/codegen/languages/PythonClientExperimentalCodegen.java
Should we do this for non-file-type only now?

nodes.bodyText:
Style nit (not necessary to change):
if six.PY3:
  e.body = e.body.decode('utf-8')

For the else case we don't need to reassign the value of e.body

commit.message: Add Tornado handling to early return
Switch bytes validation back to string
Remove bytes import from models and regenerate

nodes.bodyText:
The current variable name makes it sound like it should contain a binary value when it contains a string value.
How about changing the variable name binary to response or result or deserialized?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -377,6 +377,36 @@ def get_header(name, default=None):
         finally:
             os.unlink(file_path)
 
+    def test_deserialize_binary_to_str(self):
+        """Ensures that bytes deserialization works"""
+        response_types_mixed = (str,)
+
+        # sample from http://www.jtricks.com/download-text
+        HTTPResponse = namedtuple(
+            'urllib3_response_HTTPResponse',
+            ['status', 'reason', 'data', 'getheaders', 'getheader']
+        )
+        headers = {}
+        def get_headers():
+            return headers
+        def get_header(name, default=None):
+            return headers.get(name, default)
+        data = "str"
+
+        http_response = HTTPResponse(
+            status=200,
+            reason='OK',
+            data=json.dumps(data).encode("utf-8") if six.PY3 else json.dumps(data),
+            getheaders=get_headers,
+            getheader=get_header
+        )
+
+        mock_response = RESTResponse(http_response)
+
+        binary = self.deserialize(mock_response, response_types_mixed, True)

nodes.bodyText:
Is this working?
I am not seeing any samples have binary regex patterns.

Can you combine these two if statements?
We don't need two levels of indentation here.
You can just use:
if six.PY3 and response_type not in {"file", "bytes"}:
Note: I also switched to set definition with {} for quicker lookups.

commit.message: Regenerate after removing dangling byte string usage

nodes.bodyText:
Is this exception only raised by the self.request call?
If so can we move this up to be right after that call?
That way all of the other code can be moved out of this try block because it doesn't need to be inside it.

commit.message: Reduce the scope of the try/catch in api_client
Regenerate Python client after api_client change
Fix lint error on the generated api_client

commit.message: Add binary format test back in w/ string
Add decoding to python-experimental and regenerate
Ensure file upload json response is utf-8 encoded bytes
